---
title: Cancel virtual cards
---

# Cancel virtual cards

:::info Original content
To immediately and permanently cancel a virtual card and all physical and digital cards associated with it, call the `cancelCard` mutation.
You might think about cancellation as **deactivating** the card.

All types of cards associated to the virtual card will no longer be usable.
The card's status is `Canceling` during the process, which is irreversible, and the status changes to `Canceled` when the process is complete.

After the cancellation is complete, you'll no longer be billed for the card.


:::

Learn how to cancel virtual cards with the API.

To immediately and permanently cancel a virtual card and all physical and digital cards associated with it, call the `cancelCard` mutation.
All types of cards associated to the virtual card will no longer be usable.

<mark>note about / link to statuses</mark><br /><br />

If you use **Swan's Web Banking interface**, your users can [cancel their own cards](https://support.swan.io/hc/en-150/articles/18538920070045-Block-your-card), which is referred to as permanently blocking their cards in Web Banking.

You can also cancel [only a physical card](../physical/guide-cancel.mdx) or [only a digital card](../digital/guide-cancel.mdx).

## Guide {#guide}

1. Call the `cancelCard` mutation.
1. Add the virtual `cardId` for the card you're canceling (line 2).
1. Add the success payload, including any information you'd like to review (line 3).
1. Add rejections (not shown).

## Mutation {#mutation}

ðŸ”Ž [Open the mutation in API Explorer](https://explorer.swan.io?%3D%3D&tab=api)

```graphql {2-3} showLineNumbers
mutation CancelVirtualCard {
  cancelCard(input: { cardId: "$YOUR_CARD_ID" }) {
    ... on CancelCardSuccessPayload {
      __typename
      card {
        statusInfo {
          status
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Payload {#payload}

The payload confirms that the virtual card is `Canceled`.

```json {7} showLineNumbers
{
  "data": {
    "cancelCard": {
      "__typename": "CancelCardSuccessPayload",
      "card": {
        "statusInfo": {
          "status": "Canceled"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```
